headline.main: AFFAIRS YEAR HAPPER'S FERRY.; WHEREABOUTS OF THE REBEL FORCES.

docs.lead_paragraph: A Maryland Secessionist, direct from Winchester yesterday morning, reports that the main body of the Confederate army, lately at Harper's Ferry, to the number of about 12,000, are stationed on the Fair ground, near the city. The remainder are stationed at Bunker Hill, Romney, and at a point near Charlestown.

headline.main: MILITARY AND NAVAL MOVEMENTS.; THE HARRIET LANE.

docs.lead_paragraph: Col. HOOPER, formerly a most efficient and worthy officer of the United States Regular Army, has arrived here, from California, to tender his services to the Government. He is well known as being a first rate tacticiam, and served in the field with distinction. He goes to Washington to report himself personalty to the War Department.

docs.snippet: The detachment of United States troops sent from this place to Syracuse on Wednesday last, retunred in good health this evening.
docs.lead_paragraph: The detachment of United States troops sent from this place to Syracuse on Wednesday last, retunred in good health this evening.

headline.main: JAMAICA.; Loss of the Steamer Zulu The Cargo Destroyed Influence of the Civil War in theStates The Cause of Emancipation AGreat And-Slavery Demonstration St.Domingo.

docs.lead_paragraph: The loss of the steamer Zulu led to the impres- sion that the monthly mail would have to be sus- pended until the arrival of the Cleator, but the Hay- tian schooner Adelle, on her way to New York, having put into port for a supply of water, the Governor called upon the mail contractor to forward the mail by her, at no matter what cost.

headline.main: THE GREAT INSURRECTION.; Interesting Intelligence from the National Capital. ARRIVAL OF MAJOR-GENERAL DIX. Centinued Accessions of Federal Troops. No Movement Expected Until Congress Meets. THE CAMPAIGN IN WESTERN VIRGINIA. PREPARATIONS FOR VIGOROUS OPERATIONS. Another Proclamation by Gen. McClellan. THE MISSOURI REBELS SPILL FLYING. More United States Troops En Route for the Scene of Action. The Harper's Perry Rebels Encamped Near Winchester. CUTTING THE WIRES. MOVABLE CHATTELS. A VERITABLE SPY. REBELS AT OCCOQUAN. THE KENTUCKY COMPROMISE. THE NEW POSTAGE STAMPS. BEAUREGARD'S ADVANCE GUARD. COL. STONE ON MARYLAND HEIGHTS. THE REBEL PRISONERS. NEWS FROM MANASSAS JUNCTION. THE COMPROMISE CANARD. SHOT FOR INSUBORDINATION. WHITWORTH GUNS ARRIVED.

docs.lead_paragraph: A Committee of New-Yorkers are here to ten- der to the Government a crack American regiment of riflemen, now ready organized, and ready for the war. Major BEN PERLEY POORE, of the Rifle Battalion of Massachusetts, now Major of the Massachusetts Eighth, has been offered the Colonelcy of this regiment, and holds the offer under consideration.
